definition: the act of starting something, take the first step or steps in carrying out an action
details:
noun
- the act of starting something
= synonyms: beginning
- a turn to be a starter in the beginning of a game
= example: a turn to be a starter in the beginning of a game
= synonyms: starting
- a sudden involuntary movement
= example: a sudden involuntary movement
= synonyms: jump
- the advantage gained by beginning early, as in a race
= example: the advantage gained by beginning early, as in a race
= synonyms: head start
- a signal to begin (as in a race)
= example: a signal to begin (as in a race)
= synonyms: starting signal
- the beginning of anything
= example: the beginning of anything
- a line indicating the location of the start of a race or a game
= synonyms: scratch, starting line, scratch line
- the time at which something is supposed to begin
= example: the time at which something is supposed to begin
= synonyms: beginning
verb
- take the first step or steps in carrying out an action
= synonyms: get, get down, begin, start out, set about, set out, commence
- set in motion, cause to start
= example: set in motion, cause to start
= synonyms: begin
- play in the starting lineup
- bring into being
= synonyms: initiate, originate
- get off the ground
= example: get off the ground
= synonyms: commence, start up, embark on
- get going or set in motion
= example: get going or set in motion
= synonyms: start up
- begin or set in motion
= example: begin or set in motion
= synonyms: go, get going
- move or jump suddenly, as if in surprise or alarm
= example: move or jump suddenly, as if in surprise or alarm
= synonyms: jump
- leave
= synonyms: part, blow, take off, set off, start out, set out, set forth, depart, shove off, shove along, roar off
- bulge outward
= synonyms: pop, bulge, protrude, come out, pop out, bug out
- begin work or acting in a certain capacity, office or job
= synonyms: take up
- begin an event that is implied and limited by the nature or inherent function of the direct object
= synonyms: begin
- have a beginning, in a temporal, spatial, or evaluative sense
= synonyms: begin
- have a beginning characterized in some specified way
= synonyms: begin
